definition: to take the back roads/to take the side streets/to take the small paths
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms

sentences.english: If you come, the tiger will bite you.
sentences.chinese: 你會走大路還是抄小路避開老虎？

sentences.english: And he strode off, up the lane.
sentences.chinese: 他抄小路快速地走開了。

sentences.english: I decided to take a shortcut home.
In fact, I have traveled the bypaths in my reading as well as in my writing.
sentences.chinese: 老實說，我在讀書和寫作時都是抄小路走的。

definition: to make a detour/to take the long route
to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
to grope about in the dark
to go uphill/to spin cocoon (silkworms)/to pass away
road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
